course_title: Teaching Health and Physical Education in Primary Schools

learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate in-depth comprehension, understanding and application of the research and the theoretical underpinnings, principles and content of contemporary Health and Physical Education curriculum, to plan, structure and sequence learning goals and programs.
Identify appropriate use of a range of research-informed management, teaching and assessment strategies and practices that support student learning and inclusive participation.
Select and critically analyse a range of resources, including ICT, to enhance student engagement and achievement in HPE learning and assessment contexts.

Demonstrate critical knowledge and understanding of the policies, legislation and ethical codes, which inform the professional roles and conduct of teachers, and seek to promote student safety, inclusive and health promoting learning environments.
Demonstrate clear, fluent and coherent communication skills consistent with personal, professional and academic conventions.
